item.description:
Note: Please check this page frequently for updates and always remember to refresh the page.
Date Lesson Slides Reading Lab HW Project WEEK 1 Fri, Jan 10 Introduction to course

item.title: Policies
item.description: When in doubt about anything at all, ask questions!!! Prerequisites ALL students are expected to be familiar with all the topics covered within the required prerequisites to be in this course. That is, STA 611 or the following: STA 210 and (STA 230 or 240L) and (MATH 202, 202D, 212, or 222) and (MATH 216, 218, or 221, any of which may be taken concurrently). Students are also expected to be very familiar with R and are encouraged to have learned LaTeX or a Markdown language by the end of the course.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Supplementary Textbooks These textbooks are great resources for some of the topics we will cover. You do not need to buy them, but you may be able to borrow them from Duke library should you need extra reading materials, besides the class slides and main textbooks. R and R Markdown Resources R Markdown can be used to create high quality reports and presentations with embedded chunks of R code.
